definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Jane resolutely kept her place at the table;
sentences.chinese: 吉英毅然决然地坐在桌位上不动。

sentences.english: Rub a medical table, resolutely away, but also what?
sentences.chinese: 揉了体检表，毅然决然地离去，又能怎样？

sentences.english: He told me this with a straight face but watched my eyes closely as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 说话时表情毅然决然，但在和我眼神接触时闭着双眼。

sentences.english: He courageously and decisively confronted their challenge to his authority.
sentences.chinese: 他勇敢而毅然决然地处置了他们对他的权威的挑战。

sentences.english: He resolutely went back to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他毅然决然地重返前线。

definition: honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to glance back/fig. to regret/to have second thoughts about sth
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
to be killed for a righteous cause/to die a martyr
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to be determined to/to insist on
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
